Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek pottery plate. Glaze fired differentially, presumably because of added colour above, Outside, two red bands preserved; inside, part of frieze of alternating triglyphs and rosettes; traces of friezes to either side.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p.10, pl. 2.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.472)
